adjustment() adjustmentPeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLoggeradjustment
PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger.adjustment ( self, frame_number, from_box, timer_id, tracker_id, intervention_type = "USER" , to_box = None )
Records the frame number and locations where the tracker is moved from and to.
Records what made the adjustment.
Human - If the user made the adjustment
Model - If the MaskRCNN model made the automatic adjustment

PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger.illumination ( self, frame)
Records the average intensity of the RGB image in greyscale with values between 0 (black) and 255 (white)
Intensity = (R + G + B)/3

occuding_objects() occuding_objectsPeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLoggeroccuding_objects
PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger.occuding_objects ( self, occluding_tracks_csv, occluding_threshold = 0.8 )
Given recorded occluding objects, check the precision of ground truth onto occluding object. If precision of ground truth is above threshold, this means that object is occluded. This is the same measure as check_occlusion but data in this context is different and therefore a different function
optical_flow() optical_flowPeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLoggeroptical_flow
PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger.optical_flow ( self, frame)
Uses optical flow to measure the average magnitude of movement from the flow of pixels.
Also records the resolution of the image
Returns values in a dictionary with names: Mean Median STD Mean_Magnitude Dominant_Zoom Percent_Zoom Zoom_Dominance_Thresh Zoom_Magnitude_Thresh Dominant_Pan Percent_Pan Pan_Dominance_Thresh Pan_Magnitude_Thresh
[66] Gunnar Farnebäck. Two-frame motion estimation based on polynomial expansion. In Image Analysis, pages 363–370. Springer, 2003.
References PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger.optical_flow_pan(), PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger.optical_flow_zoom(), and PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger.previous_frame.
Referenced by PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger.get_video_characteristics().
optical_flow_pan() optical_flow_panPeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLoggeroptical_flow_pan
PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger.optical_flow_pan ( self, flow, dominance_threshold = 0.4 , magnitude_threshold = 0.5 )
Vector orientation: t+1=current frame, t=previous frame
atan( (yi^(t+1) - yi^(t)) / (xi^(t+1) - xi^(t)) )
Calculate Dominant Orientation = Peak value in orientation histogram of the imag np.histogram(np.array(vector orientation))
returns the dominant orientation given a threshold, the threshold it passed by, and the average magnitude of movement.
Makkapati, V. (2008). Robust camera pan and zoom change detection using optical flow. In National conference on computer vision, pattern recognition, image processing and graphics (pp. 73-78).
Referenced by PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger.optical_flow().
optical_flow_zoom() optical_flow_zoomPeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLoggeroptical_flow_zoom
PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger.optical_flow_zoom ( self, flow, dominance_threshold = 0.7 , magnitude_threshold = 1 )
Describe each vector's direction.
Returns 0 if diverging (zoom in), 1 if converging (zoom out), otherwise none. percent of dominance domenance threshold mean magnitude threshold
Makkapati, V. (2008). Robust camera pan and zoom change detection using optical flow. In National conference on computer vision, pattern recognition, image processing and graphics (pp. 73-78).
Referenced by PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger.optical_flow().
paused() pausedPeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLoggerpaused
PeopleTracker.src.datalogger.DataLogger.paused ( self, frame_number, pause_type, timer_id, tracker_id)
Records what initiated the pause, and for how long the pause existed for.
This requires an external timer, and will be recorded when *Play* has been selected.
